description: From the present passive infinitive of Latin certiōrō (“to make certain”), from the words used at the beginning of these writs when they were written in Latin: certiorārī volumus (“[we wish] to be made certain”).

entries.meaning: (US, law) A grant of the right of an appeal to be heard by an appellate court where that court has discretion to choose which appeals it will hear.
(Britain, law) A grant of review of a government action by a court with discretion to make such a review.
